top.DESCRIPTION:
This site was created as a result of my journey transitioning
 from embedded C/C++ to the web industry.
 When I was first assigned a project that involved 'i18n,'
 I found myself asking, 'What is this?'
With the aim of adopting i18n and sharing my understanding of it, I created this website.
Please note that information about languages other than Japanese
has been translated by ChatGPT,
so there is no guarantee that the generated text is always accurate.
Thank you for your understanding.

i18n.sec_i18n_context:
I18n (Internationalization) is a collective term for methods and tools used in web development and application development to adapt to different regions and cultures.
'I18n' is an abbreviation for 'internationalization,' and the number 18 indicates the number of letters between 'i' and 'n.'
i18n.sec_l10n_context:
'l10n' stands for 'localization,' an abbreviation for 'internationalization' (i18n).
Localization refers to the process of adjusting internationalized software or websites to specific regions or languages.
i18n.sec_message_context:
A message bundle is a mechanism for managing text messages and labels within an application.
This facilitates easy switching to different languages.
i18n.sec_multilang_context:
Multilanguage support refers to the design of web applications or software to be capable of supporting multiple languages.
This allows users to view content in different languages.
i18n.sec_langcode_context:
Each language has a standard code.
For example, Japanese is 'ja,' English is 'en,' and so on.
These codes are used when specifying a particular language in i18n.
i18n.sec_wordcode_context:
A character code is a set of rules for encoding text data.
To support different languages and character sets, it is necessary to choose the appropriate character code.
